section.title: Login
section.para: In order to log into the tamboti framework, use your cluster username and password. After clicking the login button a pop-up window will appear. Your username has to be entered in the following format.
After successful authentication, you can see the interface changed.
On the left hand side of the Tamboti you will find the document collection view.
You can see all the collections, which are accessible to you. The collection “mods “ is the root collection.
You have reading access to the grey colored collections. You have the editing access to the bold and black collections.

section.title: Create a collection
section.para: Click on the button to add a new collection to your home folder.
After creating the collection you will see the following folder view. When you click on the “collection” it gets selected and marked in blue.
You can see the following action buttons on the top of the collection. From left to right, they allow you to move, delete and edit collections or to add a new entry.

section.title: Move the collection to another location
section.para: When you click the button, a dialog window will appear and you can move the collection to any location, where you have the permissions to write.

section.title: Delete the collection
section.para: You can delete an entire collection by clicking the button. Please be aware that the deleted collections are not recoverable!

section.title: Edit permissions
section.para: You can change the permissions to the collections using the “collection permissions” button. On the first step, you get the collection sharing template.

section.title: Share with a group of cluster members
section.para: If you select to share with a group the dialog window expands as follows. You can see the existing group memberships and (e.g. publications) and the membership rights.
Click on the “New Group” Button to add a new group of users, who can edit your collection

After you click the “Add” button , you will be redirected to the “collection sharing template”. When you click the group sharing button, you will see the group “mycollection_editors” in the group menu.
You can add the members (e.g. editors) to your group by clicking the “Add Member” button. A dialog window “Add user to group” will pop-up as follows.

If you just type the first name of the user , the system will automatically suggest you the users. Add any number of users to the group. You can grant the group either read or write permissions or both
A good practice is to name the group according to your work process. Be aware that editing the users in a group is only possible for the group creator!
